text.__SUMMARY__: Penicillium amaliae is a fungus species of the genus of Penicillium. Penicillium amaliae is named after Catharina-Amalia Beatrix Carmen Victoria.
text.Further reading: Visagie, C. M.; Houbraken, J.; Rodriques, C.; Pereira, C. S.; Dijksterhuis, J.; Seifert, K. A.; Jacobs, K.; Samson, R. A. (2013). "Five new Penicillium species in section Sclerotiora: A tribute to the Dutch Royal family". Persoonia. 31: 42–62. doi:10.3767/003158513X667410. PMC 3904052. PMID 24761034.
